file_content.text: Don't be alarmed. I'm with the Republic Strategic Information Service, deeply embedded. I took a gamble you'd be curious enough about the "malfunction" I devised to stop a moment.
A serious problem's brewing. The Empire is about to violate the Treaty of Coruscant by attacking Kuat Drive Yards.
A serious problem's brewing. One of the Empire's most feared admirals is about to launch an attack on Kuat Drive Yards.
Kuat provides the bulk of the Republic's warship production. If the Empire takes control, we're in bad shape.
The Empire won't take control of a single wrench if I have anything to say about it.
Point me to the problem.
You'll have your work cut out for you, Jedi, but with you on board, I like our chances.
Absent a healthy armada, the Republic would be crushed, and the Empire would be free to menace the galaxy.
An understatement.
Leave it to a well-spoken Jedi like yourself to drive the point home.
The Empire won't take a thing--not if Havoc Squad has anything to say about it.
I'll handle it.
Great. The Drive Yards operation could use a stronger military presence, even if it isn't entirely by the book.
The Empire isn't exactly good for business. Tell me what I can do to help.
That would be bad.
Had a feeling I wouldn't have to work hard to persuade a smart entrepreneur.
If the Empire is on the attack, we should be doing all we can, not sneaking around.
Why so secretive?
The Empire might attempt to claim Kuat under the Treaty due to its proximity to Balmorra. Better to keep silent.
Agreed. Unfortunately, the politics surrounding Kuat are such that no one likes having attention drawn to it.
I don't even know you. How am I supposed to know that what you're saying is true?
I don't trust you.
You don't have to take my word for it.
There's no official call to arms, but if you were to... simply show up, I 'm sure Fleet Admiral Aygo will be relieved to see you.
You don't think the admiral will ask questions?
This channel won't be secure much longer. I should go. Best of luck keeping Kuat Drive Yards in Republic hands.
Not by then, he won't; he'll have his hands full. Just be sure to get the proper clearance codes for safe travel to the Kuati fleet.
Good luck.
